description: Primes of the form abbbbb... where a and b are digits.
links: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..352 (first 79 terms from Harry J. Smith)
example: 4111 is a member where a=4 and b = 1.
maple: N:= 20:A:= 2,3,5,7:for n from 2 to N do  for a from 1 to 9 do    for b in [1,3,7,9] do       p:= a*10^(n-1) + b*(10^(n-1)-1)/9;       if isprime(p) then A:= A,p fi    od  odod:A;  # _Robert Israel_, Oct 13 2014
mathematica: f[n_] := Select[ Union@ Flatten@ Table[ FromDigits@ Join[{a}, Table[b, {n - 1}]], {a, 9}, {b, {1, 3, 7, 9}}], PrimeQ]; Array[f, 5] // Flatten (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 29 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) { n=r=0; default(primelimit, 1777777777); forprime (p=2, 1777777777, if (p>100, r=p\10; d=p-r*10; while (r>9 && r-r\10*10 == d, r\=10)); if (r<=9, write("b061022.txt", n++, " ", p)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 16 2009
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Jun 23 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Dean Hickerson_, Jul 10 2001
